raw_text:
Based on the provided paper, I'll extract the structured information following the schema:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Evaluating the Impact of a Graduation Program in Paraguay",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Sembrando Oportunidades Familia por Familia (SOF)",
    "country": "Paraguay",
    "region": "Rural areas",
    "target_population": "Rural households in extreme poverty"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "consumption support",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "Specifically, the graduation approach program is an integrated intervention that focuses on five elements: asset transfer, consumption support, savings, technical training, and life skills development."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["productive assets", "livestock"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "The positive impacts of the program on the households' assets (especially livestock) and savings. | Specifically, the graduation approach program is an integrated intervention that focuses on five elements: asset transfer, consumption support, savings, technical training, and life skills development."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "income/earnings",
      "savings/financial",
      "asset accumulation",
      "labor supply",
      "food security",
      "well-being",
      "poverty reduction",
      "empowerment"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "Given that the graduation approach is an integrated intervention, to capture the changes provoked by the program, the evaluation considered the measurement of different dimensions: per-capita and independent work income, savings, expenditure, food security, productive assets, subjective welfare, and daily hours dedicated to work.",
    "study_design": "Instrumental Variables (IV)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "Given the impossibility of performing the originally-planned RCT, the evaluation of the SOF program was implemented through an Instrumental Variable impact evaluation (IV) method",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2016-2017",
    "sample_size": 1084,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "Rural poverty, a widespread problem for the Paraguayan government over the last decade -as well as for other economies in the region-, led to the implementation, in 2016 and 2017, of the 'Sembrando Oportunidades Familia por Familia' pilot program",
    "country_citation": "To address this situation, the Paraguayan government developed the 'Reducción de Pobreza Extrema -Inclusión Productiva y Social' project",
    "target_population_citation": "the incidence of extreme poverty in urban areas in Paraguay was 1.64% in 2016, a figure far lower than that attained in rural areas (11.2%)"
  }
}
```
